trans-unit.source: Selects columns to include or exclude from a dataset in an operation
trans-unit.target: Selects columns to include or exclude from a dataset in an operation

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Project Columns</ui> module to choose a subset of columns to use in downstream operations.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Project Columns</ui> module to choose a subset of columns to use in downstream operations.

trans-unit.source: This can be useful if you want to use only a few columns for a specific operation or if you want to generally reduce the size of the dataset.
trans-unit.target: This can be useful if you want to use only a few columns for a specific operation or if you want to generally reduce the size of the dataset.

trans-unit.source: For example, <ui>Project Columns</ui> is the tool to use in these scenarios:
trans-unit.target: For example, <ui>Project Columns</ui> is the tool to use in these scenarios:

trans-unit.source: You need to “block off” some text columns in the dataset so you can apply a math operation to all numeric columns.
trans-unit.target: You need to “block off” some text columns in the dataset so you can apply a math operation to all numeric columns.

trans-unit.source: When applying feature selection, you want to pass through only a subset of the categorical feature columns.
trans-unit.target: When applying feature selection, you want to pass through only a subset of the categorical feature columns.

trans-unit.source: You have many numerical columns to normalize and want to apply a different normalization operation to different columns, so you create a data projection for each group of columns.
trans-unit.target: You have many numerical columns to normalize and want to apply a different normalization operation to different columns, so you create a data projection for each group of columns.

trans-unit.source: This module does not reorder output columns based on the order of the column list value selected in the input.
trans-unit.target: This module does not reorder output columns based on the order of the column list value selected in the input.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you specify columns by using an order such as (4,3,2,1), the projected columns will appear in the output according to the original dataset order (1,2,3,4).
trans-unit.target: For example, if you specify columns by using an order such as (4,3,2,1), the projected columns will appear in the output according to the original dataset order (1,2,3,4).

trans-unit.source: For examples of how to use <ui>Project Columns</ui>, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how to use <ui>Project Columns</ui>, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Breast cancer detection </linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525726</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses <ui>Project Columns</ui> to remove a trailing empty column, remove a column with duplicate data, and to project training and test sets.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Breast cancer detection </linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525726</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses <ui>Project Columns</ui> to remove a trailing empty column, remove a column with duplicate data, and to project training and test sets.

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Flight delay prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/837e2095ce784f1ba5ac623a60232027</linkUri></externalLink> sample, <ui>Project Columns</ui> is used to exclude all string columns and to exclude columns by name.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Flight delay prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/837e2095ce784f1ba5ac623a60232027</linkUri></externalLink> sample, <ui>Project Columns</ui> is used to exclude all string columns and to exclude columns by name.

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Prediction of student performance</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525727</linkUri></externalLink> sample, <ui>Project Columns</ui> is used to get all temporal features, and to exclude multiple columns.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Prediction of student performance</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525727</linkUri></externalLink> sample, <ui>Project Columns</ui> is used to get all temporal features, and to exclude multiple columns.

trans-unit.source: In the <externalLink><linkText>Compare Regressors</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525731</linkUri></externalLink> sample, <ui>Project Columns</ui> is used to exclude the column, <embeddedLabel>num-of-doors</embeddedLabel>, because it is the wrong data type for the math operation that follows.
trans-unit.target: In the <externalLink><linkText>Compare Regressors</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525731</linkUri></externalLink> sample, <ui>Project Columns</ui> is used to exclude the column, <embeddedLabel>num-of-doors</embeddedLabel>, because it is the wrong data type for the math operation that follows.

trans-unit.source: In relational algebra, a <newTerm>projection</newTerm> is a unary operation, which is written as a set of attribute names.
trans-unit.target: In relational algebra, a <newTerm>projection</newTerm> is a unary operation, which is written as a set of attribute names.

trans-unit.source: The result of a projection is the set of those attributes, with other attributes discarded.
trans-unit.target: The result of a projection is the set of those attributes, with other attributes discarded.

trans-unit.source: In database terms, a <newTerm>projection</newTerm> is a function (such as a Transact-SQL or LINQ statement) that takes a table as input and produces a related output.
trans-unit.target: In database terms, a <newTerm>projection</newTerm> is a function (such as a Transact-SQL or LINQ statement) that takes a table as input and produces a related output.

trans-unit.source: Technically speaking a view is not always a projection, because a view that is a projection can use data from only one table, and selection conditions (WHERE statements) cannot be applied.
trans-unit.target: Technically speaking a view is not always a projection, because a view that is a projection can use data from only one table, and selection conditions (WHERE statements) cannot be applied.

trans-unit.source: Select columns to keep in the projected dataset.
trans-unit.target: Select columns to keep in the projected dataset.

trans-unit.source: For a list of all exceptions, see <link xlink:href="60822377-da7a-40b8-aec7-d185d1509344" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Module Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of all exceptions, see <link xlink:href="60822377-da7a-40b8-aec7-d185d1509344" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Module Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if one or more specified columns of the dataset couldn't be found.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if one or more specified columns of the dataset couldn't be found.

trans-unit.source: An exception occurs if one or more input datasets are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: An exception occurs if one or more input datasets are null or empty.
